data.title: best hotdogs in Sioux City
data.text: The hotdogs are delicious! Not greasy, just the right amount of chili, mustard and onion. The buns are always soft. Good service too.

data.title: Simply the Best
data.text: Born & raised in Sioux City. This has always been the "GO TO" joint in town. Just thinking of the smell of the onions and the chilli sauce gets me to crave for one.

data.title: Going Since 1918 - This Place Rocks - It's All About the Owners
data.text:
I absolutely love Coney Island.  George Margeas opened this store in 1918 and ran it his whole life.  His son Steve Margeas has been running it every since.  He and his wife Virginia can be found in the store every day.  In my mind, they make the difference.  It's their restaurant, their history, and their love.

The restaurant is located on Nebraska St between 5th and 6th street.  As far as looks go, it's nothing special beyond the history of how long it's been here.  I do like seeing the hot dogs on the grill through the window from the street.  It's a nice touch.

The coney's are absolutely wonderful.  Steve still makes them while you wait.  He pulls out a soft bun from the steamer and lays a hot dog from the grill in it.  Mustard is applied to the side with a dip stick (love that tradition).  Chili still made the same way as it was in 1918 is spooned over the hot dog.  Freshly diced onions top it off.  Once George is done Virginia will finish off the sides and drinks and ring you up.  Cash only!

While the hot dot is being prepared right in front of you, George and his wife are talking up a storm.  They are the sweetest couple.  I cannot decide if I keep visiting when I come back to enjoy them or the awesome coney.  Either way, I get both and that makes this place a rock star.

I am very sad that their son George S. Margeas died unexpectedly in 2009.  He had his own store opened and was running it.  He was the heir apparent to keep this store going.

data.title: authentic coney dogs and other great menu items
data.text: Family-owned, authentic recipes, and retro atmosphere----can't go wrong! Chili sauce on the coney dogs is YUMMY!

data.title: Local favorite, family owned hot dogs!
data.text: This local hot dog eatery has been here forever with the same quality menu.  I know we have gone here over the last 20 years living in the area.  The owners are usually very friendly and appreciate the patrons that come in to support their local business.  We usually go with chili and cheese dogs and their fries are good as well.  A must stop for hot dog lovers!

data.title: good dogs, same as they have been for 30 plus years
data.text: Pretty good hot dogs. Love the chili. Good downtown location. Same flavor and quality every time I stop in, over 30 years now...

data.title: Hometown goodness.
data.text: Good hot dogs. It's a place you need to stop at when returning to your home town.The original building was torn down to make room for the Hard Rock.

data.title: I like Coney Island but . . .
data.text:
I admit I like Coney Island and always enjoy going but I just do not go very often. CI is the sort of place people who have moved out of the area want to go to when they come back to town. That is usually when I have gone . . . when a friend returns to town and wants to go. Otherwise, I rarely make the decision to go on my own. 
There are 2 Sioux City locations. Parking can be difficult at this particular location, the location downtown. If it is a weekday, you will be in competition for a spot with those working or doing business downtown. You will likely have more luck on Saturday but keep in mind  they close early on Saturday, I believe 2:00. (It might even be earlier.) They are not open Sunday.
When you come to CI, get the chili dog. It was what they are known for and what they do best. I like mine with ketchup and other locals enjoy adding onions. Service is usually fast but I have not always found it to be the friendliest. That could be because I am not there very often and no one knows me. Still, I just might stop by more often if greeted with a smile and a bit of conversation. Then again, they get enough business they probably feel they do not need mine. 
Check hours before you go.

data.title: Best dogs in the tri state area!
data.text: I've been going to the Coney Island all my life. If you love a great chili dog this is the place. Next time in Sioux City make sure you stop by.

data.title: good hot dogs - like going back in time
data.text: The Coney Island never changes - just good hot dogs, great chili, reasonable prices and fast, friendly service. I have eaten here from time to time for almost 40 years. Worth a try if visiting Sioux City for a quick bite.

data.title: Go for the Nostalgia Not the Food
data.text: This place has been in the same location in downtown Sioux City since the 30s. Granted, Nathan's it ain't. I'm not a hot dog connoisseur, but I found the hot dogs (had two) to be tasty and the buns soft and moist. With a bag of chips and a cup of coffee is was an okay lunch. What makes the place is the friendly older folk who work there and the ambiance. It's a step back into time with much of the original decor and style from the 50s, 60s or earlier. I remember the place from my youth when there were nearby movie theaters. I had the strange feeling that I was in a Twilight Zone episode. I usually don't rank atmosphere over food, but this is one exception. Go for the feel.

data.title: Not worth it except for the History
data.text: I love Hot Dogs.  But this is not the place.  The downtown building this is located in is full of history, and some neat photos in the restaurant.  The owner/manager? at the counter was friendly and courteous.  However, the charm stops there.  The dogs were blah, and the buns were dry.  Cleanliness of the joint left something to be desired.  This place is a Sioux City icon...but I just can't recommend it.
